Forecasting¶

tstoolkit.forecasting_models module¶

class tstoolkit.forecasting_models.LearnerManager¶

Bases: object

A class that manages the learners.

class tstoolkit.forecasting_models.SplitType(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: Enum

An enum that represents the split type.

TEST = 'test'¶
TRAIN = 'train'¶
VALID = 'valid'¶
class tstoolkit.forecasting_models.TsaiLearnerManager(arch: str, arch_config: dict, loss_func: Callable, metrics: list[Callable], x: ndarray, y: ndarray, splits: tuple, artifacts_path: Path, batch_size: int, pipelines: Iterable[Pipeline] = ((),), callbacks: Iterable[Callback] = ((),), **kwargs)¶

Bases: LearnerManager

A class that manages the Tsai learners.

Parameters:

  • arch (str) – The architecture to use.

  • arch_config (dict) – The architecture configuration.

  • loss_func (Callable) – The loss function for training.

  • metrics (list[Callable]) – Evaluation metrics.

  • x (np.ndarray) – The inputs x.

  • y (np.ndarray) – The inputs y.

  • splits (tuple) – The train/val/test splits.

  • artifacts_path (Path) – The path where to store the artifacts (checkpoints).

  • batch_size (int) – The batch size.

  • pipelines (Iterable[Pipeline], optional) – The data-preprocessing pipelines.

  • callbacks (Iterable[Callback], optional) – The callbacks used during training.

evaluate(x: ndarray, y_true: ndarray, split_type: SplitType = SplitType.VALID) → DataFrame¶

Evaluates the validation set.

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) – The inputs of shape (batch_size, n_vars, seq_len)

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – The targets of shape (batch_size, n_vars, horizon)

  • split_type (SplitType, optional) – The split type., defaults to SplitType.VALID

Returns:

Evaluation Metrics Value

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

export_model(artifact_name: str) → None¶

Exports the model.

Parameters:

artifact_name (str) – Name of the artifact to be saved.

find_max_lr() → float¶

Find the maximum learning rate.

Returns:

Max Learning Rate

Return type:

float

fit(epochs: int, lr_max: float | None = None) → None¶

Fits the model.

Parameters:

  • epochs (int) – Number of Epochs

  • lr_max (float | None, optional) – Learning Rate, defaults to None

get_forecast_plot(x: ndarray, y_true: ndarray, y_pred: ndarray, sel_vars: bool = True, idx: int = 0) → None¶

Gets the forecast plot.

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) – The inputs of shape (batch_size, n_vars, seq_len)

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – The targets of shape (batch_size, n_vars, horizon)

  • y_pred (np.ndarray) – The predictions of shape (batch_size, n_vars, horizon)

  • sel_vars (bool, optional) – Whether to plot the variable separately., defaults to True

  • idx (int, optional) – The index of the sample in the batch to plot., defaults to 0

get_summary() → str¶

Returns the summary of the learner.

Returns:

Summary

Return type:

str

load_model(artifact_name: str) → None¶

Loads the model.

Parameters:

artifact_name (str) – Name of the artifact to be loaded.

predict(x: ndarray) → ndarray¶

Predicts the targets.

Parameters:

x (np.ndarray) – The inputs of shape (batch_size, n_vars, seq_len)

Returns:

The predictions of shape (batch_size, n_vars, horizon)

Return type:

np.ndarray
